- Prefer Julia standard libraries, avoid new packages unless explicitly requested.

# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

Here is the requested function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str, text_width = 10)
    words = split(input_str, ' ') # Split string into words
    output_str = ""
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            output_str *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    
    # Add the last non-empty line.
    output_str *= "$line\n"
    
    return output_str
end
```

You can use this function like this:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", 10))
```

This will wrap the text every 10 characters. The `*` operator is used for string concatenation in Julia.
